Milk in infancy

What monster need milk in the first 5 months?And should I give milk for 5 months to a monster that dislike milk?Pls answer oh Master Trainers out there.
A new player Sophia :)

-- SophiaTeh (MonsterRancher@hotmail.com), December 30, 1999
Answers
even if they dont like milk, i give milk to them for 5 months! its the best thing for them at that time. melenium link out~

-- Link (Gr Jarkeld@Aol.Com), December 30, 1999.

I am a master traner and if the monster does not like the milk you can still feed it to him for the 5 monthes and he will not like you vary much but if you just go to drill and not go to all the battles you should be ok but don't schould him all the time he is not sucseccful in a drill. A few other tipes for the first 5 monthes don't go to hard drills or any entry no matter waht or if you do I have found that the monster will not be able to aquire as man tecneques compared to a monster that waits for 5 or six monthes

-- Brandon Lastine (airanglell@aol.com), December 30, 1999.

Give most of the smaller monsters the milk

-- Brandon lastine (airanglell@aol.com), December 30, 1999.

Give EVERY monster milk for the first 5 months of its life regardless of wether or not it the monster likes it.

-- El_Buttweasle (el_buttweasle@yahoo.com), December 30, 1999.

you must feed them all milk intil they are five months old no matter what a monster will live a long and happy life if you do this and many other tips on this page all of my monsters have lived five years at least so keep it up and I hope it helps

-- Sterling Routson Thomas (creeky@gateway.net), December 30, 1999.

There is "no" real evidence to the effects of feeding milk during baby stage has any thing to do with living long or anything such.
All we know, is that it is cheaper for some "unknown" reason during these first 4 months. It also changes the monster's liking towards milk one notch up during this time.
I feed my monsters milk because I don't want to experience the consequences of not feeding it, if any at all.

-- RNA (RNA@Ribosome.nuc), December 31, 1999.

You really don't need to feed newborn monsters milk. It is just a rumor. Just feed it what it likes. If it is too expensive, try another type of food. Monsters like a couple of foods,they will show it on their faces after you select the type of food you want to give it!

-- Bealcon (---@---.com), February 10, 2000.

By Kurasu Soratobu on Monday, June 26, 2000 - 10:42 am:

Lately, I only feed my monsters tablets all the way through, and they seem to be doing pretty well with my raising style. I haven't done any comparisons with food-using, yet, though I can now pretty accurately judge a monster's lifespan by how early it enters Stage 2 (yeah, yeah... biiiig truck, Kura!)
